text: now there have been two explosions in
the center of the ugandan capital
kampala one blast took place near the
parliament with the other going off
close to the city's police headquarters
there are reports that at least six
people have been killed and several
others injured patients are to hurry
it's in kampala
what we do know is that one of the
explosions happened right close to the
central police station this is right in
the heart of kampala a very very busy
area with lots of traffic both human and
vehicular traffic and when it happened
it was close to a shopping mall and very
close also across the road to the
central police station
the second blast happened less than a
kilometer away very close to the offices
of the city authority but also very
close to parliament and just as we came
in uh our police were still searching
the scene forensic investigators we can
still see them behind us searching the
scene and even using some bomb detection
dogs to try and look all across the
cordon all around the area of parliament
this is a very high profile
area with lots of high-profile buildings
and government offices and ministries
it is shocking especially for this
particular area because it's a very
highly polished area so there is a lot
of talk on social media in uganda about
what this means and this is just less
than a month after two explosions last
month in different parts of the country
including in one part of kampala so yes
it's very very shocking
